answers.answer: My sister in law had preeclampsia, its basically that your pregnancy is causing extremelly high blood pressure, and the only cure for it is delivery.  She had to be induced a few weeks early.  I would look up ways to keep your blood pressure down, try to take it easy, not stress, and limit salts, but if it keeps up induction will be necessary for your health and the babies.

I developed pre clampsia, or toxemia, later in my pregnancy and had no major swelling or protein/sugar in my urine. My bp was fine throughout my whole pregnancy up until the last couple of weeks. My bp was really high like 166 high. I had the choice of inducing or csection but my lil girl was in distress and probably would of had to have a csection anyway. She was born 4 weeks and 2 days premature perfectly healthy
I'm sorry to hear you had troubles but thank you for sharing your experience I appreciate it :)

I had severe preeclampsia with my first pregnancy. I almost died. It wasn't detected until it was too late. I had to have an emergency csection at 35weeks. They wouldn't let me push my son out. I was at risk for stroking since my bp was so high and pushing him out was not an option.
Forgot to mention i to had protein in my urine. My bp got to 198/131. I also had significant swelling. I also gained 35lbs in water weight in less than a week.

That is terrible, glad you are okay now though. I was a little concerned because I've always had excellent blood pressure but its spiked all of a sudden.. Will see what my ob says about and if its gone up any more by my next appointment.. Scary stuff.

question: Hey mommies :) had an appointment today at 31 weeks, and my doctor said I have had a spike in my blood pressure and that this is a sign of preeclampsia .. My BP has been regular and pretty much the same all the way through but now it's changed.. I do have frequent headaches and the last two weeks i have been feeling unwell a lot, not sleeping well, but no swelling.. My doctor says I may need inducing if my BP continues to rise. Anyone had this experience? I really don't know what preeclampsia is or anything.. Thanks in advance! Xx
title: Pre-eclampsia?
